an4.19:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four ways of making prejudiced decisions.
an4.19:4.3: Making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.19:4.4: These are the four ways of making prejudiced decisions.
an4.19:5.1: There are these four ways of being making unprejudiced decisions.
an4.19:5.3: Making decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.19:5.4: These are the four ways of being making unprejudiced decisions.”
an4.19:6.2: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,
an4.19:6.4: like the moon in the dark fortnight.
an4.19:7.1: If you don’t act against the Dharma
an4.19:7.2: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,
an4.19:7.4: like the moon in the bright fortnight.”
